releases.name: v26.0.0 - Revision 8 + super beta 8xx support
releases.body:
### **UPDATE 2**: Added working a8xx Turnip. **Please read the notes below.**  - Thanks whbexium
### **UPDATE**: Fixed an issue with the drivers not loading properly.

## Based on latest mesa main source v26.0.0-devel.

## v26.0.0 R8
Vulkan 1.4.335
Base commit:  e9a83d530cce

### NOTES

## The a8xx support included is **very** beta and hacky. **Use at your own risk!**  
An example of what might happen (which happened to me) using this with Mincraft Pojav-glow-worm on a840, it will crash and the default driver won't recover causing every apps to crash afterwards. (a reboot fixed it) 

What works very well: OpenGL games through x86_64 emulators.
What does not work: Switch emulators and non OpenGL games (so far tested. They boot but render very buggy graphics).

---

- This still uses Old autotuner. If you need new Autotuner, [use v25.3.0 here](https://github.com/K11MCH1/AdrenoToolsDrivers/releases/edit/v26.0.0-rc.03).

- a710 and 720 can use regular or Gmem. When using regular driver on Winlator, do uncheck sysmem and check gmem from the TU_DEBUG list in the Environment Variables. For other emulators, use Gmem driver.
- For users with the ONE UI bug, use the following environmental variable: `FD_DEV_FEATURES = enable_tp_ubwc_flag_hint=1`

---

### CHANGELOG

- Merged upstream.
- General optimizations and bug fixes.

---

### APPLIED PATCHES

**Turnip_v26.0.0_R8_Gmem.zip**
- Added a710/720 GPU descriptors (hacks)

**Turnip_v26.0.0_R8_Autotuner.zip**
- Autotuner Overhaul

**a8xx_0x5_handle.zip**
- Added a830v2 GPU descriptor (hack)
- Added 0x5 handle (hack)
Thanks Hardware Union RU/ENG boys

---

### Thanks to ‚ù§Ô∏è
Rob Clark
Karmjit Mahil
Connor Abbott
StevenMX
Pablo
Mark
Weabchan
JeezDisReez
Danylo
Mesa Team

releases.name: v26.0.0 - Revision 3 + v25.3.0 with NEW Autotuner
releases.body:
## Based on latest mesa main source v26.0.0-devel.

## v26.0.0 R3
Vulkan 1.4.330
Base commit: 13148afd0

## v25.3.0
Vulkan 14.328
Base commit: 13148afd0
Repo: [PixelyIon/mesa/-/tree/tu-newat](https://gitlab.freedesktop.org/PixelyIon/mesa/-/tree/tu-newat)

- Compatible with Winlator Bionic through Adrenotools settings and "Wrapper" graphics driver.
- Compatible with Micewine.  

---

### Notes  

- `Turnip v25.3.0 PREFER_SYSMEM/PROFILED` contains the new Autotuner that is not yet merged to main source. For testing purposes.
- The Turnip drivers above may not work for a710/720 as forcing Gmem is not possible on them.
- `Turnip_v26.0.0_R3` contains old autotuner and gpu a710/720 hacks. Has a perf regression which is fixed with the ones below.
- `Turnip_v26.0.0_R3_CB_Perf_Fix` contains old autotuner, a perf fix and gpu hacks.
- `Turnip_v26.0.0_R3_CB_Perf_Fix_Gmem` contains the perf fix, gpu hacks and forced Gmem for a710/720.
- `Turnip_v26.0.0_R3_CB_Perf_Fix_Sysmem` contains the perf fix, gpu hacks and forced Sysmem.
- a710 and 720 can use regular or Gmem. When using regular driver on Winlator, do uncheck `sysmem` and check `gmem` from the TU_DEBUG list in the Environment Variables. For other emulators, use Gmem driver.

What is Autotuner

Automatically benchmarks each shader using both sysmem (system memory) and gmem (GPU memory) rendering paths. Over multiple render passes, it measures the execution time of each mode and determines which one consistently performs better. As it gathers more data, it gradually favors the faster mode for that shader, improving performance dynamically in real time. Depending on the workload, it may offer better performance.

**Currently v26.0.0 has the old Autotuner.**

---

### CHANGELOG

- Merged upstream.
- General optimizations and bug fixes.

---

### APPLIED PATCHES

**Turnip_v26.0.0_R3_CB_Perf_Fix:** 
- a710/720 support hack
[Fix CB overhead when running without CB being used.](https://gitlab.freedesktop.org/mesa/mesa/-/merge_requests/38378)

**Turnip_v26.0.0_R3_CB_Perf_Fix_Gmem:** 
- As above + Force Gmem.

---

### Thanks to ‚ù§Ô∏è
Connor Abbott
StevenMX
Pablo
Mark
Weabchan
JeezDisReez
Danylo
Mesa Team

## It's time for a new development cycle.
## Based on latest mesa main source v26.0.0-devel.

Vulkan 1.4.328

Base commit: cc1d942727

- Compatible with Winlator Bionic through Adrenotools settings and "Wrapper" graphics driver.
- Compatible with Micewine.  

---

### Notes  

- a710 and 720 use Autotuner or Gmem. When using Autotuner on Winlator, do uncheck `sysmem` and check `gmem` from the TU_DEBUG list in the Environment Variables.
- Winlator users should uncheck `sysmem` from the TU_DEBUG list in the Environment Variables when using Autotuner.  

---

### What is Autotuner  
Automatically benchmarks each shader using both sysmem (system memory) and gmem (GPU memory) rendering paths. Over multiple render passes, it measures the execution time of each mode and determines which one consistently performs better. As it gathers more data, it gradually favors the faster mode for that shader, improving performance dynamically in real time. Depending on the workload, it may offer better performance.

**Regular driver below does not have Autotuner.**

---

### CHANGELOG

- Merged upstream.
- Bumped up version to 26.0.
- General optimizations and bug fixes.

---

### APPLIED PATCHES

**Turnip_v26.0.0_R1_Autotuner:** 
- a710/720 support hack
-  autotuner.  

**Turnip_v26.0.0_R1_Gmem:** 
- a710/720 support hack

releases.body:
## Based on latest mesa main source v25.2.0-devel.

Vulkan 1.4.318

Base commit: 7544aae77c

### Compatible with Winlator Bionic through Adrenotools settings and "Wrapper" graphics driver.
### Compatible with Micewine.

---

### CHANGELOG

- Merged upstream.
- General optimizations and bug fixes.

---

> [!NOTE]
> <samp> - May not work with DXVK 2.6 and up.  </samp>
> <samp> - `GMEM` for a710 and a720 Winlator users.  </samp>  
> <samp> - `AUTO` for anyone else. However might still need to enable `SYSMEM` on Winlator/Micewine via `TU_DEBUG`</samp>  

> **If full screen artifacing happens, try using the [gmem] tagged driver.**

---

<details>

<summary>üìú What is Autotuner:</summary>

The Autotuner in Mesa's Turnip drivers dynamically selects between GMEM (tile-based, on-chip memory) and sysmem (direct system memory rendering) modes to optimize performance for Adreno GPUs. It uses heuristics to make decisions but can be overridden with TU_DEBUG options for debugging or to address specific issues. While effective in many cases, the Autotuner may struggle with certain workloads or newer GPUs, requiring manual configuration or updated driver variants for optimal performance. Which is why the unsupported GPUs mentioned above may need GMEM.

</details>

---

### MERGED PATCHES

- Hacky a710 and a720.

---

### Thanks to ‚ù§Ô∏è
Pablo
Mark
Weabchan
JeezDisReez
Danylo
Mesa Team

# Mesa Turnip driver v25.2.0 - Revision 12


Based on latest mesa main source v25.2.0-devel.

Vulkan 1.4.318

Base commit: eecf94cc

### Compatible with Winlator Bionic through Adrenotools settings and "Wrapper" graphics driver.
### Compatible with Micewine.

---

### CHANGELOG

- Merged upstream.
- Bumped Vulkan version to 1.4.318.
- General optimizations and bug fixes.

---

> [!NOTE]
> <samp> - `GMEM` for a710 and a720 Winlator users.  </samp>  
> <samp> - `AUTO` for anyone else. However might still need to enable `SYSMEM` on Winlator/Micewine via `TU_DEBUG`</samp>  

> **If full screen artifacing happens, try using the [gmem] tagged driver.**

---

<details>

<summary>üìú What is Autotuner:</summary>

The Autotuner in Mesa's Turnip drivers dynamically selects between GMEM (tile-based, on-chip memory) and sysmem (direct system memory rendering) modes to optimize performance for Adreno GPUs. It uses heuristics to make decisions but can be overridden with TU_DEBUG options for debugging or to address specific issues. While effective in many cases, the Autotuner may struggle with certain workloads or newer GPUs, requiring manual configuration or updated driver variants for optimal performance. Which is why the unsupported GPUs mentioned above may need GMEM.

</details>

---

### MERGED PATCHES

- Hacky a710 and a720.

---

### Thanks to ‚ù§Ô∏è
Pablo
Mark
Weabchan
JeezDisReez
Danylo
Mesa Team

releases.name: GameHub Lite v5.3.3 RC-1 [PRE-RELEASE]
releases.body:
GameHub Lite v5.3.3 RC-1 [PRE-RELEASE]

This is an experimental build that adds **Micro SD Card Support** for **Steam Games** based on GameHub v5.3.3.

There is no support for this build, this is meant for those who are helping out or want to tinker.

**IMPORTANT:**

- Enable SD Card support in the settings before downloading Steam games
- Switching storage location back and forth hasn‚Äôt been tested yet.
- It will create a directory named `GHL` on your SD Card where the downloaded Steam games will be stored. (FF modders, go wild).
- This version can be installed alongside GHL v5.1.3 for easy testing.
- The full Steam client doesn‚Äôt work in this version, use Steam Lightweight or use GameHub Lite 5.1.3 which is stable.

releases.body: changelog: - Uses GameHub Lite v4 as it's basis instead of v3 - Resolved broken intents with launchers (ESDE/Beacon/Dajisho) - Fixes brightness bug - Adds EmuReady compatibility badge back - Uses the new EmuReady workers server for better privacy - Removed the Notification Permissions popup properly - Removed the Free Games section since it doesn't work anymore - Removed the unneeded resources files for services we're not using anymore - Restored the Microphone Permission for games that require it Full credits go to [Trixarian](https://github.com/Trixarian), this is just a signed version to make it easy to update from `v5.1.0` --- Please check [EmuReady](https://www.emuready.com) for recommended settings if a game doesn't run well before asking in the [Discord](https://discord.gg/CYhCzApXav) server for help.

releases.name: GameHub Lite v5.1.0
releases.body:
A restoration build of GameHub Lite V4 before everything fell apart. I will publish the code for the workers and a patch very soon, for now enjoy a working GameHub Lite app again.

We'll focus on restoring the previous functionality first, before fixing and adding functionality. So please only report issues that were not present in GameHub Lite V4 or in the official GameHub app.

---

### Explanation for the different versions

You‚Äôll often see an emulator distribute different versions with a name suffixed like **PUBG**, **Antutu**, **Optimized**, **Genshin**, **Ludashi** and other names. Here follows an explanation for what is what, is still has slight differences between manufacturers and even different packagenames but it should give you a rough understanding.

‚Äî-

*The different versions are identical. What we do is a very old android trick to gain extra performance on some devices.*

**Antutu**

Some manufacturers ‚Äúcheat‚Äù by setting the governor to performance when they detect the Antutu package name. 

*Nerd explanation:*

The CPU governor essentially controls the CPU's frequency scaling. allowing it to operate at different clock speeds and voltages based on the system load. So making the CPU go fast for sustained usage, what is actually made for peak usage. This comes with a risk of overheating, but I don‚Äôt believe in this. Android does a well enough job of thermal management and makes it extremely hard for software to exceed what the hardware is capable of and damaging itself.


That said, it‚Äôs still extra heat. More heat == more bad. I just think it‚Äôs negligible, especially if your device has a fan.


**PUBG**

On a high level it‚Äôs the same as Antutu, but some slight differences that only benefit games. Think of network prioritization and touch input latency improvements. The manufacturers goal when they detect Antutu is **ALL THE POWER**. Benchmarks are relatively short and it makes them look better on comparison websites.


The goal for PUBG is more like **MORE POWER**, since the intention is often to have a game running for longer it has less aggressive changes.


**TLDR and summary:**

**Antutu** spoofing:

    ‚Ä¢    Maximum CPU/GPU frequencies unlocked  
    ‚Ä¢    Aggressive performance governors  
    ‚Ä¢    Short-duration performance boost (benchmark workload)  
    ‚Ä¢    Thermal limits are less strict   
    ‚Ä¢    All cores available  


**PUBG** and other games spoofing: 

    ‚Ä¢    Sustained gaming performance profiles  
    ‚Ä¢    GPU driver optimizations (Adreno/Mali game-specific paths)  
    ‚Ä¢    Frame pacing and scheduling improvements  
    ‚Ä¢    Reduced touch latency   
    ‚Ä¢    Network QoS prioritization  
    ‚Ä¢    Different thermal management (sustained vs burst)  
    ‚Ä¢    Qualcomm ‚ÄúGame Performance Mode‚Äù      
    ‚Ä¢    Sometimes enables features like frame-gen


**Ludashi** spoofing:

    ‚Ä¢    Similar to Antutu but slightly less aggressive    
    ‚Ä¢    Longer sustained performance boost (multi-minute tests)   
    ‚Ä¢    Memory frequency optimization

releases.name: GameHub Lite v5.0.0
releases.body:
This is a temporary release that restores most of the functionality previously available in GameHub Lite v4.

GameHub Lite v4 stopped working after the former developer took down the Cloudflare Workers it relied on, citing privacy concerns. 

We are currently developing a community-funded solution to provide a more stable and permanent setup.

In the meantime, this version includes most of the core features but may display some visual inconsistencies and lacks certain extras that were present in v4, such as the news and free games sections.

Special thanks to **The412Banner** and **Trixarian**!

[Join the EmuReady Discord for support and more information](https://discord.gg/CYhCzApXav)

releases.name: GameHub Brasil v2.0
releases.body:
# üéÆ GameHub Brasil v2.0 üáßüá∑

## üåü Destaques desta Vers√£o O GameHub Brasil v2.0 chega para revolucionar como voc√™ gerencia seus jogos e drivers. Focamos totalmente na flexibilidade e compatibilidade, permitindo que voc√™ importe seus pr√≥prios arquivos, gerencie perfis de controle com facilidade e leve a experi√™ncia de jogos para dispositivos de qualquer gama de desempenho. --- üöÄ Novidades e Recursos Implementados --- ## üì•AdrenoHub Drivers (Adrenotools). ‚úÖ Integra√ß√£o Adrenotools: Sistema robusto para gerenciamento de drivers Vulkan. üìÇ Importa√ß√£o Flex√≠vel: Suporte para importa√ß√£o de drivers Turnip no formato .zip. üíæ Fontes Variadas: Carregue drivers de fontes externas ou diretamente do armazenamento local do seu dispositivo. ## releases.name: GameHub 5.3.5 Lite V2-hotfix
releases.body:
Changelog:
‚Ä¢ Ported SD Card support from recent [GameHub 5.3.3 Release Candidate](https://github.com/Producdevity/gamehub-lite/releases/tag/v5.3.3-RC1) releases
‚Ä¢ Merged two APKs into one - added API switch into settings, by default it's set to EmuReady API, can be switched to official GameHub API, restart the app after changing API

Hotfix:
‚Ä¢ Included Documents Provider patch (access to /data/data without root)

releases.name: GameHub 5.3.5 Lite V1
releases.body:
Ported [GameHub Lite 5.3.3](https://github.com/Producdevity/gamehub-lite/releases/tag/v5.3.3) modification to 5.3.5, two versions included, general changes:
- Disabled Discover and Free games tabs (as they don't work in both versions)
- DocumentsProvider patch included (app's /data/ can be accessed through file managers)
- Preserved original GameHub resources (icon and stuff, lazy to replace)
- Used package name - emuready.gamehub.lite
- Signed with testkey

Official API version:
- Uses GameSir server for downloading firmware/drivers/other components, usually up to date, may have privacy concerns
- More cluttered My Games list, includes PC/PS Link (idk if it is working)
- Can import Android games
- No login required
- Offline is working

EmuReady API version:
- Uses EmuReady server to download firmware/drivers/other components, more private
- Has more GPU drivers to download, but may not have the latest components to download
- Clean My Games list (only Windows emulation and Steam)
- Can't import Android games
- No login required
- Offline is working

Only difference in APK files are https server strings, everything else is the same!

releases.name: Gamehub Lite RedMagic
releases.body:
Fully Released build for Gamehub Lite 5.1.3 RedMagic. Feel free to help develop features!

Features:
Custom intro logo
Frame generation
Less touch latency

Going to add a check for updates feature for steam games in future versions!

Frame generation only works for Devices with a Game Manager and support ME/MC, like the Honor 400 pro.
